meanings.definition: To surpass in number or population.
meanings.sent1: The blue team outpeoples the red team in players.
meanings.sent2: During the game, the visiting team outpeoples the home team.
meanings.sent3: The ants outpeoples the picnic-goers, claiming the food as their own.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the sky outpeoples the grains of sand on the beach.
meanings.sent5: The forest outpeoples the city in terms of natural beauty.

meanings.definition: To exceed in terms of the number of people.
meanings.sent1: The concert crowd outpeoples the capacity of the venue.
meanings.sent2: The line at the store outpeoples the available cashiers.
meanings.sent3: The birthday party outpeoples the small living room, making it feel crowded.
meanings.sent4: The excitement outpeoples the fear in the room.
meanings.sent5: The laughter outpeoples the silence, filling the room with joy.

meanings.definition: To outnumber in terms of population.
meanings.sent1: The students outpeoples the teachers in the school.
meanings.sent2: The bees outpeoples the other insects in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The puppies outpeoples the adult dogs in the park, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The cheers outpeoples the boos in the stadium.
meanings.sent5: The flowers outpeoples the weeds in the garden, creating a colorful display.
